channel.title: Working flash and java in a 64-bit system!
channel.description:
Well, as you know if you use any 64-bit OS (windows included) the people at Sun and Adobe are bastards for not providing a plugin for java or flash for 64-bit browsers. This guide shows you how to install a 32-bit firefox and the plugins to work along with your 64-bit firefox, it is geared toward ubuntu but will work for any distro, it works great on mine:
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FirefoxAMD64FlashJava

item.title: Working flash and java in a 64-bit system!
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

MNG’s google it, sorry it was a typo… MNG’s started a while ago but still doesn’t have too much support from browsers yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Working flash and java in a 64-bit system!
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“kloplop321, post:17, topic:79085”]soon enough MPG’s(like GIF’s but more in a png format with frames instead of 256 color w/alpha bitmaps) will be as universal as flash in the next few years.[/quote]mpegs are movies, they are unlike flash in every single way, please get a clue what you are talking about

Read full topic

item.title: Working flash and java in a 64-bit system!
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

soon enough MNG’s(like GIF’s but more in a png format with frames instead of 256 color w/alpha bitmaps) will be as universal as flash in the next few years.
sorry, typo (MNG’s instead of MPG’s)

item.source: Working flash and java in a 64-bit system!

item.title: Working flash and java in a 64-bit system!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:15, topic:79085”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=116161.msg1180879#msg1180879 date=1176988716]
i ask you again, what the fuck is the point of a 64bit web browser
[/quote][/quote]

It is faster on floating point calculations? Probably not much to be honest, but they should compile a 64-bit plugin anyway.

kloplop321:

so can toy check out my flash version of your title bar, as it is much smaller and less to download for everybody, thus giving your server less to send and at the same time has a faster response?

I checked it out, and while it looks better, I still prefer an image that doesn’t require any proprietary plugins and is universally supported.

Read full topic
item.source: Working flash and java in a 64-bit system!

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

I thought the whole point of OSS was that you can examine how it works, and change what you want changed

Which is why sun and adobe need to release the source code to their plugins. Then I could compile them myself.

item.title: Working flash and java in a 64-bit system!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

kloplop321:

does this mean you can actually stop boycotting flash but still be mad at adobe?

I can now use flash and applets when I want to, but I have to close my 64-bit FF first. I’m still mad at both companies until they make the 64-bit plugin.

Read full topic
